description.p: A master of stealth, skill, and decisive strikes.
As a Rogue, you gain the following class features.
Hit Dice: 1d8 per Rogue level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Rogue level after 1st
Armor: Light armor
Weapons: Simple weapons, and Martial weapons that have the Finesse or Light property
Tools: Thievesâ€™ Tools
Saving Throws: Dexterity, Intelligence
Skills: Choose four from Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background.

When you deal Sneak Attack damage, you can forgo some of that damage to add an extra effect. Each effect has a die cost; remove that many Sneak Attack dice before rolling. The effect occurs immediately after damage is dealt. Save DC for effects that require one = 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your Proficiency Bonus.

description.p: Poison (Cost: 1d6). You add a toxin to your strike, forcing the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the Poisoned target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. To use this effect, you must have a Poisoner's Kit on your person.
